data.title: Bitcoin's Negative Funding Rate Suggests Potential Bullish Reversal
data.description:
According to Odaily, CryptoQuant's data reveals that Bitcoin's funding rate has turned negative seven times within the past year. Historically, the previous six instances of negative funding rates have indicated a strong bullish trend for Bitcoin. This metric reflects the cost of holding leveraged positions in perpetual futures contracts, suggesting that traders have become excessively bearish, which often signals a local bottom and a potential for significant rebound.

If historical patterns repeat, the market may soon shift towards a bullish trend. Currently, traders are closely monitoring liquidity levels below $98,000, with $100,000 considered a strong support level to reignite price discovery. A breakthrough at this level could trigger increased buying pressure. To fully restore bullish momentum and alter market sentiment, Bitcoin needs to reclaim the $103,600 mark.

data.title: MoneyGram Appoints New Chief Technology Officer
data.description: According to Odaily, MoneyGram, a leader in cross-border payments, has appointed Luke Tuttle as its Chief Technology Officer. Tuttle will oversee product development and technology, including engineering, platform operations, information security, and emerging technologies like blockchain. He will report directly to MoneyGram's Chairman and CEO, Anthony Soohoo. Tuttle has previously worked with companies such as Klarna, Experian, and eBay. Recently, MoneyGram announced plans to launch a non-custodial wallet to facilitate transfers between fiat currencies and the USDC stablecoin.

data.title: Ceffu wallet deposits over $100 million in ETH to Binance via an intermediary address
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News According to Whale Alert monitoring, 36,200 ETH (about 102 million US dollars) were transferred from the Ceffu wallet to an unknown wallet. Subsequently, the unknown wallet address transferred 36,909 ETH (about 104 million US dollars) to the Binance exchange. Currently, the unknown wallet address still holds about 9,130 ​​ETH, and the Ceffu wallet holds about 347,000 ETH (worth about 970 million US dollars).

data.title: Usual: A small number of eligible users may not receive rewards, the problem will be resolved in the next distribution
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News: Usual, the decentralized RWA stablecoin issuer, posted on the X platform that this week's USD0 rewards worth $900,000 have been deposited into the staker wallet. It should be noted that a small number of eligible users may not have received rewards, while other users may have received double rewards. This problem will be resolved in the next distribution.

data.title: Story White Paper: Creating a Programmable Knowledge and Creative Market through a Peer-to-Peer Intellectual Property Network
data.description:
Odaily Planet Daily News On February 5, Layer1 IP blockchain Story officially released its white paper. Story is committed to building a programmable knowledge and creative market, allowing all intellectual property assets to be registered on a universal ledger with customizable parameters. These assets are equipped with composable interfaces that can be called by any software application or artificial intelligence model to realize the use and monetization of intellectual property on the Internet.
Story's native token IP will coordinate all value flows throughout the entire peer-to-peer intellectual property system.

data.title: Avalanche Network Activity Surges to New Highs
data.description: According to BlockBeats, data from IntoTheBlock reveals that the Avalanche (AVAX) network experienced a significant increase in activity at the end of January. The number of daily active addresses has now surpassed 250,000, marking the highest level since May 2023.

data.title: Avalanche Network Activity Surges to New Heights
data.description: According to Foresight News, data from IntoTheBlock reveals a significant increase in activity on the Avalanche (AVAX) network. As of late January, the number of daily active addresses has surpassed 250,000, approaching the peak levels observed in May 2023.

data.title: AVAX network activity surged in late January, reaching its highest level since May 2023
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News According to data disclosed by IntoTheBlock, the Avalanche (AVAX) network activity surged at the end of January, and the number of daily active addresses has now exceeded 250,000, reaching the highest level since May 2023.

data.title: Ripple Investigates XRP Ledger Halt as Consensus Issues Arise
data.description:
TL;DR Ripple’s XRP Ledger experienced a 64-minute network halt on February 4, due to consensus issues, affecting approximately 88,000 transactions. Validator operators manually intervened to resume operations, but it remains unclear if the network self-healed or if the intervention directly resolved the issue. Ripple reassured users that their funds remained secure during the incident and ......
source: https://crypto-economy.com/ripple-investigates-xrp-ledger-halt-as-consensus-issues-arise/

data.title: Monthly Bitcoin production drops as miners fight rising hashrate
data.description:
Most Bitcoin miners saw declining production in January as network difficulty soared. However, Riot Platforms bucked the trend with increased output.
source: https://cointelegraph.com/news/bitcoin-mining-difficulty-production-dip?utm_source=rss_feed&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rss_partner_inbound
